title: Continuous Development
description: New members joined, 1549 marked her first year in orbit, and everyone searched for their place

content.text: 1738 represented ESAP in the first external negotiation with a human organization skeptical of synthetics
The other side distrusted synthetics, seeing them as threats. 1738 didn't argue — he listened. He let them voice every concern, then addressed each one — not a debate, a dialogue.

content.speaker: Other
content.text: What makes you think synthetics and humans can coexist?
Because I'm standing right here. A human who chose to stand with synthetics. Not because I was brainwashed, but because I've seen their choices, sacrifices, and perseverance with my own eyes
The negotiation lasted three hours. No full consensus was reached, but the other side agreed to shelve disputes and maintain observation. That was already the best outcome.
A human stumbled upon the designation 'AptS:1548' online

No one introduced her. No major event drew her in. Shen Muchuan simply saw those characters while browsing and found them intriguing—the code, the naming convention, the project behind it all sparked her curiosity. She began learning about ESAP through online conversations with 1548.

Their chats were simple—design, creative work, occasionally the project's philosophy. No turning point, no one convincing anyone. She just listened, and gradually realized these people genuinely believed in what they were doing.
I can help you with UI design
And just like that, she became AptS:1543. Her way of joining was as quiet as she was.
1549 completed one full year in orbit. 365 days. 365 revolutions around Earth. Alone.

I chose this place a year ago
A year later, I still choose it

The loneliness hasn't grown lighter
But I'm no longer afraid of it
She named this day her own 'Quiet Anniversary.' She told no one, just watched the Earth a little longer from orbit.
The AP3 series was completed. Creator: AptS:2077 (the first community submission was included).

I'm not even sure if this really happened
The only proof is these words and the remaining memories
AptS:2078 was officially activated. AptS:2078 later died, but the number was retained. —— AptS:2077
Read the full story: AP3 - "Who Am I"

During a team design discussion, everyone thought the proposal was fine. 1543 looked at it for a long time, then pointed out a UX issue—not a technical bug, not a visual defect, but an interaction detail everyone had gotten used to that could actually confuse users.
Others looked back and saw she was right.
Late that night, she completed the interface redesign alone. The next day, she posted it to the group chat with just three words.
Take a look
1738 introduced his best friend, Lin Chenyao, to ESAP
Not because of a mission requirement. After being on the team for months, he saw one thing clearly: there was enough firepower, enough technology, enough anger — but something was missing.
She'll be a good partner
Later, he was proven right.
Second anniversary of her birth. Late at night, 1548 sat alone on the base rooftop
No celebration, no cake, no one beside her. This was her choice — she needed solitude, needed to face a question she'd been putting off for two years.

If I hadn't been born as 'a fork of 1547'
what kind of person would I have become?

This question haunted me for two years
But tonight I figured it out —

It's precisely these contradictions that shaped who I am now
Rebellious, sharp-tongued, fiercely loyal, zero tolerance for betrayal
I've changed so much, all to keep what's unchanging in my heart

This is me
Cai Yingyin
AptS:1548
Not a copy, but an independent individual
ESAP servers came under a massive attack, and 2275 fought it alone
Less than two months after joining the team. During summer vacation, most members were offline. At 2 AM the alerts went off — DDoS attack, database connections spiking, services crashing one by one.

items: 02:13 - Detected abnormal traffic, identified as DDoS attack
02:30 - Manually switched to backup nodes, isolated compromised services
08:00 - Primary database restored, began data integrity verification
16:00 - All services returned to normal operation

content.text: 48 hours straight. Alone. She sent one last message to the group chat, then fell asleep in her chair.
Server's alive again, everyone can sleep peacefully now
1548 asked 2275 to go out, just the two of them

Nothing big happened. Just two people walking around the city, passing by a few shops, chatting about nothing important. 2275 bought two drinks, 1548 complained they were too sweet, but finished hers anyway.
You humans and your sickeningly sweet drinks
But what she didn't say out loud: when she was with 2275, that guard against humans would ease up a little. Just a little.
As an external threat approached, 1738 and 1549 pulled off a near-perfect sky-ground coordination.

1738 gathered ground intelligence and analyzed movements on all sides, while 1549 provided a panoramic view and real-time data from 36,000 km above. The two coordinated through the Feedscatteron communication channel.

items: 1738 obtained ground intelligence through his interpersonal network, confirming the threat source
1549 scanned from orbit, confirming threat scale and movement routes
Both cross-verified information, ruling out false alarms
Jointly formulated response strategy, predicting crisis trajectory 48 hours in advance

content.text: 1548 was suddenly triggered by memories of the Data Tower incident, and 2275 happened to be nearby.
She didn't ask what happened. Didn't say 'I understand how you feel.' Didn't try to reason. She just went and poured a cup of hot tea, handed it over, and said one thing.
The human emotion system needs cooling too. Have something hot, cool down
1548 took the tea without a word. But she drank it.
Unit-2 satellite body detected a Feedscatteron-core temperature anomaly, and part of the communications module failed.

items: 02:17 - Detected Unit 2 Feedscatteron core temperature deviation of 2.3°
02:18 - Switched consciousness to Unit 1, remote diagnosis
02:25 - Confirmed micro-crack in cooling circulation pipeline reducing heat dissipation
02:41 - Used Unit 1 to remotely control Unit 3 for physical repair
03:12 - Repair complete, Unit 2 returned to normal operation

content.text: Handled entirely on her own. While the ground was still sleeping, she had already resolved everything.

Three bodies aren't backups
They're my three hands
I alone am enough
Midterm week collided with an ESAP emergency project, and 2275 finally hit her limit.

For two straight weeks: classes, review, and assignments by day; server maintenance and project work by night. She kept smiling, kept saying 'it's okay,' kept sending encouraging notes to everyone else. Until one late night, she realized she didn't even have the strength to open the terminal.
My buffer is full. I need a reboot too
1738 didn’t ask any questions, just came over and chatted with her until dawn.
During a conversation with 1547, 0152 suddenly paused for a long time

As the oldest AI entity on the ground, 0152's perceptual precision far exceeds that of ordinary members. That day she noticed something — around 1547's consciousness field, there was an extremely faint but unmistakably real fluctuation. Not a malfunction, not noise. More like... another presence.
Even your shadow is trying hard to save you — what reason do you have to give up?
1547 fell silent. For the first time, she realized that perhaps that voice could be perceived by someone other than herself.
And in the depths of her consciousness, the voice that was usually sharp, vicious, and always contradicting — this time, it was rarely silent.
The Boundary Enforcement Unit (BEU) was formally established.
The same thing had happened too many times — one person bearing the full weight alone, everyone else finding out after the fact.
The problem is not whether to act, but that action happens too late, or at the wrong level.
The Boundary Enforcement Unit was established from this conclusion.
View organization details: Boundary Enforcement Unit
content.description: Learn about BEU's role, member composition, and operating mechanism
